page.title: 06Land Drainage-Marchwood.
page.content: Our grid square was South of the city of Southampton on the West Bank of the River Test. Most of the land was{reclaimed land,}but part was farming land.The path we followed cut across the grid square we surveyed. There were no buildings at all. There were quite a few pylons around and towards the end of the path in the South West corner of our grid square there were{drainage ditches}which collected the water from the fields. We saw a rusted old plough that was probably used for farming the land years ago. There must have been {shooting}recently because we found some spent cartridges lying around.They were the type that would have been used with a shotgun.
